intro: Micranthus silvestris, commonly known as the forest micranthus, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a low-maintenance, shade-tolerant plant.
